member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_Init(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function should be called to use other functions in iMON Display API. When the caller application calls this function, API tries to request Display Plug-in Mode to iMON.
member.param: API will send/post message to this handle.
API will send/post message to hwndNoti with this message identifier.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.InvalidArguments or DisplayResult.OutOfMemory can be returned when error occurs.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_Uninit
member.summary: This function should be called when the caller application need not use this API any more. If this function call is missed, iMON can't display other information.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_IsInited
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to know if API is initialized.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. If API is initialized, this call will return DisplayResult.Initialized. Otherwise DisplayResult.ApiNotInitialized will be returned.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_IsPluginModeEnabled
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to know if API can control iMON display.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. If API can control iMON display, this call will return DisplayResult.InPluginMode. Otherwise DisplayResult.NotInPluginMode will be returned.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetVfdText(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to display text data on VFD module.
member.param: This string data will be displayed on the 1st line of VFD module. It doesn't support multi-byte character and if string data is longer than 16 characters, it displays 16 characters from the first.
This string data will be displayed on the 2nd line of VFD module. It doesn't support multi-byte character and if string data is longer than 16 characters, it displays 16 characters from the first.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.InvalidPointer, DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetVfdEqData(iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayEqualizerData@)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to display equalizer data on VFD module.
member.param: Pointer of DisplayEqualizerData structure. The caller application should fill this structure with the equalizer data for 16 bands.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.InvalidPointer, DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdText(System.String)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to display text data on LCD module.
member.param: This string data will be displayed on the LCD module. It supports multi-byte character and if string data is longer than display area, it will start to scroll. When text scrolling is finished, API will notify it with DisplayNotifyCode enumeration value, DisplayNotifyCode.LCDTextScrollDone.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.InvalidPointer, DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdEqData(iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayEqualizerData@,iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayEqualizerData@)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to display equalizer data on LCD module.
member.param: Pointer of DisplayEqualizerData structure. This parameter represents equalizer data of left channel. The caller application should fill this structure with the equalizer data of left channel for 16 bands.

Pointer of DisplayEqualizerData structure. This parameter represents equalizer data of right channel. The caller application should fill this structure with the equalizer data of right channel for 16 bands.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.InvalidPointer, DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdAllIcons(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to turn on/off all icons on LCD module.
member.param: If this value is TRUE, iMON will turn on all icons. Otherwise, iMON will turn off all icons.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdOrangeIcon(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to turn on/off orange shaped disk icons on the upper left part of LCD module. Disk icons consist of 8 pieces of orange and orange peel.
member.param: Each bit represents one of icons shaped the piece of orange. MSB is used for the piece placed on top and the remaining bits are for the piece placed in CCW from top.
MSB represents the orange peel shaped icon. Other bits are not used.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdMediaTypeIcon(System.Byte)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to turn on/off media type icons on the upper part of LCD module.
member.param: Each bit represents one of media type icons. From MSB each bit represents MUSIC, MOVIE, PHOTO, CD/DVD, TV, WEBCASTING and NEWS/WEATHER icon.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdSpeakerIcon(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to turn on/off speaker icons on the upper right part of LCD module.
member.param: Each bit represents one of speaker icons.\nFrom MSB each bit represents L, C, R, SL, LFE, SR, RL and SPDIF icon.
MSB represents RR icon. Other bits are not used.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdVideoCodecIcon(System.Byte)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to turn on/off codec icons for video file on the lower part of LCD module.
member.param: Each bit represents one of video codec icons. From MSB each bit represents MPG, DIVX, XVID, WMV, MPG, AC3, DTS and WMA icon.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdAudioCodecIcon(System.Byte)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to turn on/off codec icons for audio file on the lower part of LCD module.
member.param: Each bit represents one of audio codec icons. From MSB each bit represents MP3, OGG, WMA and WAV icon.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdAspectRatioIcon(System.Byte)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to turn on/off aspect ratio icons on the lower right part of LCD module.
member.param: Each bit represents one of aspect ratio icons. From MSB each bit represents SRC, FIT, TV, HDTV, SCR1 and SCR2 icon.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdEtcIcon(System.Byte)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to turn on/off icons on the lower left part of LCD module.
member.param: Each bit represents icon. From MSB each bit represents REPEAT, SHUFFLE, ALARM, REC, VOL and TIME icon.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: M:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.IMON_Display_SetLcdProgress(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function can be used when the caller application wants to display progress bar on the upper and lower left part of text area of LCD module.
member.param: It represents the current position of progress bar.
It represents the total length of progress bar.
member.returns: This function will return one of DisplayResult enumeration value. DisplayResult.Succeeded will be returned if succeeded. DisplayResult.NotInitialized or DisplayResult.Failed can be returned if failed.

member.name: T:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayType
member.summary: These enumeration values represent display type. Currently iMON Display API supports VFD and LCD products.

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayType.VFD
member.summary: VFD products

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayType.LCD
member.summary: LCD products

member.name: T:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult
member.summary: These enumeration values represent the returned result for iMON Display API function calls. All iMON Display API function calls return one of this result values. For meaning of each result, refer the comment of each line below

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.Succeeded
member.summary: Function Call Succeeded Without Error

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.Failed
member.summary: Unspecified Failure

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.OutOfMemory
member.summary: Failed to Allocate Necessary Memory

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.InvalidArguments
member.summary: One or More Arguments Are Not Valid

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.NotInitialized
member.summary: API is Not Initialized

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.InvalidPointer
member.summary: Pointer is Not Valid

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.Initialized
member.summary: API is Initialized

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.ApiNotInitialized
member.summary: API is Not Initialized

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.InPluginMode
member.summary: API Can Control iMON Display (Display Plug-in Mode)

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayResult.NotInPluginMode
member.summary: API Can't Control iMON Display

member.name: T:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayNotifyCode
member.summary: These enumeration values represent the notification codes. iMON Display API will send or post message to the caller application. The caller application should assign the message and the winodw handle to receivce message with IMON_Display_Init fucntion. These enumeration values are used with WPARAM parameter of the message.

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayNotifyCode.PluginSuccess
member.summary: When API succeeds to get the control for the display, API will post caller-specified message with DSPNM_PLUGIN_SUCCEED as WPARAM parameter. LPARAM represents DSPType. This value can be 0x01 (VFD), 0x02 (LCD) or 0x03 (VFD+LCD).

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayNotifyCode.PluginFailed
member.summary: When API fails to get the control for the display, API will post caller-specified message with DSPNM_PLUGIN_FAILED as WPARAM parameter. LPARAM represents error code with DSPNResult.

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayNotifyCode.iMonRestarted
member.summary: When iMON starts, API will post caller-specified message with DSPNM_IMON_RESTARTED as WPARAM parameter.\n LPARAM represents DSPType. This value can be 0 (No Display), 0x01 (VFD), 0x02 (LCD) or 0x03 (VFD+LCD).

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayNotifyCode.iMonClosed
member.summary: When iMON closed, API will post caller-specified message with DSPNM_IMON_CLOSED as WPARAM parameter.\n LPARAM is not used.

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayNotifyCode.HardwareConnected
member.summary: When iMON HW newly connected, API will post caller-specified message with DSPNM_HW_CONNECTED as WPARAM parameter.\n LPARAM represents DSPType. This value can be 0 (No Display), 0x01 (VFD), 0x02 (LCD) or 0x03 (VFD+LCD).

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayNotifyCode.HardwareDisconnected
member.summary: When iMON HW disconnected, API will post caller-specified message with DSPNM_HW_DISCONNECTED as WPARAM parameter.\n LPARAM is DSPNResult value, DSPN_ERR_HW_DISCONNECTED.

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayNotifyCode.LCDTextScrollDone
member.summary: When iMON LCD finishes scrolling Text, API will post caller-specified message with DSPNM_LCD_TEXT_SCROLL_DONE as WPARAM parameter.\n The caller application may need to know when text scroll is finished, for sending next text.\n LPARAM is not used.

member.name: T:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayEqualizerData
member.summary: This structure contains Equalizer data for 16 bands.

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayEqualizerData.BandData
member.summary: Represents Equalizer data for 16 bands. Its range is from 0 to 100.

member.name: T:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayInitResult
member.summary: These enumeration values represent the result status for requesting Display Plug-in Mode to iMON. iMON Display API notifies one of this result values to the caller application after requesting Display Plug-in Mode to iMON. For more information, refer the comment of each line below

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayInitResult.Succeeded
member.summary: Display Plug-in Mode is Initialized Successfully

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayInitResult.PluginModeAlreadyInUse
member.summary: Display Plug-in is Already Used by Other Application

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayInitResult.HardwareNotConnected
member.summary: iMON HW is Not Connected

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayInitResult.HardwareNotSupported
member.summary: The Connected iMON HW doesn't Support Display Plug-in

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayInitResult.PluginModeDisabled
member.summary: Display Plug-in Mode Option is Disabled

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayInitResult.iMonNotResponding
member.summary: The Latest iMON is Not Installed or iMON Not Running

member.name: F:iMon.DisplayApi.iMonNativeApi.iMonDisplayInitResult.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown Failure
